item.title: Blabla
item.description: Something should be posted here, but this person is so lazy ~

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi there ~ My name is Peirong Liu (刘沛榕), I am a 3rd year PhD student in Computer Science at UNC-Chapel Hill, where I am fortunate to be advised by Dr. Marc Niethammer. Before this, I received my bachelor’s degree in Mathematics from Shanghai University, where I graduated with class rank 1/305, and was awarded the President’s List, National Fellowship, Baogang Fellowship, and Outstanding Graduate in Shanghai, China. My research interests center on machine learning, computer vision and medical imaging.

item.title: News
item.description: 2021 03.22 ~ I will join Facebook AI’s Computer Vision team as a Research Intern for Summer 2021. 03.01 ~ One paper accepted as Oral at CVPR 2021, “Discovering Hidden Physics Behind Transport Dynamics'' [pdf] 2020 09.05 ~ New preprint on Arxiv: “Perfusion Imaging: A Data Assimilation Approach'' [pdf] 08.12 ~ New preprint on Arxiv: “Local Temperature Scaling for Probability Calibration'' [pdf] 06.23 ~ One paper accepted at MICCAI 2020, “Fluid Registration Between Lung CT and Stationary Chest Tomosynthesis Images'' [pdf]
